alert.note: Alert for South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 6:09PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Albany and southwestern Laramie Counties through 645 PM MDT... At 608 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Crystal Lake Campground, or 18 miles west of Cheyenne, moving southeast at 30 mph. Another strong storm was developing just south of Federal and moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Crystal Lake Campground and Crystal Lake Reservoir. This includes Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 337 and 354. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills
